page.title: 11FARMING (page 3)
page.content: In the area there is an intensive egg-production business. The hens (some 30,000 total) are housed in units and fed meal and water automatically. The eggs are sold to an egg-exporter and a large proportion of them is sent to England. Alongside the stock rearing is the production of fodder for animals in winter. The two methods of conserving grass for winter use are making { {silage}and{hay},and both are used.{ {Barley}is grown,too,and the grain is crushed,and possibly mixed with other meals,as winter feed. Extensive use is made of machinery throughout the area. Tractors operate ploughs,rotavators,fertiliser- spreaders,slurry tankers,grass-cutting and hay machinery,grinders etc. Balers and combine-harvesters etc.have led to a reduction in the number of workers.
